intro: Bouvardia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered bouvardia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Bouvardia macrantha is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in indoor environments.
